page.title: 10CRUDWELL VILLAGE BLACKSMITH
page.content: {The old smithy}has been in the same family for four hundred years.It is now run by{Mr Bert Tidmarsh and his {son.}The four workers start work at 7.30am.They don't shoe many horses in the smithy because of the noisy traffic outside.Instead{they travel {round to farms and stables.}They take a{portable forge}with them so that they can make the shoes fit properly. There are lots of tools in the smithy that the men make for themselves.The men make the horseshoes from{strips of {metal}that they heat in the furnace. They use{an electric fan now}to get the fire going{but still have some {large bellows in working order. Everywhere you look you can see horseshoes in many different sizes and weights.
